Operation 'searchFlightAvailabilities' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_context, missing_output_details, missing_input_details. Original summary is generic and description is completely empty. Added clarity on what the operation searches for (specific parameters), what it accepts (POST with GetFlightAvailabilitiesQuery), what it returns (FlightAvailability collection with details), and important context about test environment limitations from the API documentation. This enables AI agents to understand when to use this operation and what to expect.

data.current_summary: Return list of Flight Availabilities based on posted searching criteria.
data.summary_suggestion: Search for available flights by criteria
data.description_suggestion: Searches for flight availabilities matching the specified criteria including departure/arrival airports, travel dates, passenger count, and cabin class. Accepts a POST request with search parameters defined in GetFlightAvailabilitiesQuery. Returns a collection of FlightAvailability objects with pricing, routing, and airline information. Results are sourced from the Amadeus flight database. Note: Test environment contains a subset of production data; use major airports/cities (e.g., LON, NYC) for reliable results.
